page.title: 08Farming - Westerton
page.content: Westerton, an arable farm close to Lochgelly has a varied collection of animals and crops. The sheep and cows are evenly distributed throughout the farm and around 225 of each are kept. Regarding crops, there are seventeen fields, each of seventeen acres containing hay and barley. Most of the hay is used for fodder; any extra is sold. Half of the barley crop is sold however, and only half is kept for fodder. The farmer has many kinds of machinery, the most important being harvesters, bailers and rollers. The farmer and his brother are the only workers on the farm and often work up to 17 hours a day to finish the job. The public cause many problems for the farmer unfortunately as they walk over fields and allow dogs to run/
